paper_abstract: A path between distinct vertices u and v of the n-dimensional hypercube Q(n) avoiding a given set off faulty vertices is called long if its length is at least 2(n) - 2f - 2. We present a function phi(n) = Theta(n(2)) such that if f <= phi(n) then there is a long fault-free path between every pair of distinct vertices of the largest fault-free block of Q(n). Moreover, the bound provided by phi(n) is asymptotically optimal. Furthermore, we show that assuming f <= phi(n), the existence of a long fault-free path between an arbitrary pair of vertices may be verified in polynomial time with respect to n and, if the path exists, its construction performed in linear time with respect to its length. (c) 2009 Elsevier Inc. All rights reserved.
paper_title: Long paths in hypercubes with a quadratic number of faults
